ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I feel more prepared to tackle the professional world of the theater/performing arts industry.
Familiarity with how to build an artist's statement and portfolio, and opinions about what I want my own to look like.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The workload was appropriate I feel.

I think the support for playwrights could be stronger in general in the theater department. Especially in terms of scheduling the readings. But I think it was really helpful for those who did productions.
I really enjoyed the in-class discussions of artist's statements. I can't come up with any major ways to improve the course.
It's exactly what it needs to be for the purposes of senior project development.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes-- this is a must (whether you like it or not!) for any theater studies major.
If changes happen. We can talk, that's not for here.

Its required if youre completing a production-based thesis, but its also just quite a fun class to be a part of. While the work of staging the thesis production is very demanding, the class itself is a great support system, so I would recommend. Even if youre doing a playwriting or essay thesis, its nice to meet with your peers once a week to get a sense of everyones progress.
Babes you kinda have to take itI do recommend that those not doing productions take it though. It's fun to not be alone in a library writing sometimes.
This is weird for this class because you have to be a TDPS senior to take it, but I guess if I were talking to a senior writing a paper who had the option to take it or not I would say take it.
You literally don't have a choice. It's a fun swan song for your time in the department, though.
